result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn Matthew Piering

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: EZ. Defendant Shawn Matthew Piering in court.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Shawn Matthew Piering.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Beltran states there is a conflict and unable to proceed in the case and request adjournment for successor counsel.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Atty. Beltran moves to withdraw.  Court allows Atty. Beltran to withdraw.
Hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Clerk: EZ. Defendant Shawn Matthew Piering in court.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Shawn Matthew Piering.  Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel's first appearance.

Preliminary hearing on October 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Clerk: EZ. Defendant Shawn Matthew Piering in court, in custody.  Attorney Laykin Stone in court for Shawn Matthew Piering.  Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Defendant eligible for State Public Defender.  State requests $500-750.00 cash bond.  Atty. stone requests a signature bond.  Defendant is on a PO hold.  Court orders $500.00 cash bond.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:15 am.
